data.title: List of unicorn startup companies
data.text:
Private startup companies valued at over 1 Billion USD

This is a list of unicorn startup companies. In finance, a unicorn is a privately held startup company with a current valuation of US$1 billion or more. Notable lists of unicorn companies are maintained by The Wall Street Journal,[1] Fortune Magazine,[2] CNNMoney/CB Insights,[3][4] TechCrunch,[5] PitchBook/Morningstar,[6] and Tech in Asia.[7]

Historical progress of unicorns # Unicorns Total valuation

(US$ billions) Date Reported by 39 Late October/Early November 2013 TechCrunch[8] 82 Late January 2015 Forbes, CB Insights[9] 229 1,300 January 2016 VentureBeat[10] 208 761 December 2016 TechCrunch[5] 224 771.9 April 2017 TechCrunch 193 665 April 2017 Inc magazine[11] 266 861 August 2018 CB Insights[3] 394 1,200 August 2018 CB Insights[12] 495 1,566 November 2020 CB Insights[12] 963 3,140 January 2022 CB Insights[12] 1,170 3,854 June 2022 CB Insights[13] 1,219 3,823 August 2023 CB Insights[13]

Table of the number of unicorn startups by country as of October 7, 2022 Country Number of unicorns Number of unicorns per million people US 702 2.12 China 302[14] 0.21 India 113[15] 0.08 UK 49 0.72 France 34[16] 0.5 Germany 29 0.35 Israel 24 2.77 Brazil 24 0.11 Canada 20 0.48 South Korea 16 0.31 Argentina 14 0.31 Singapore 14 2.39 Japan 12 0.09 Indonesia 8 0.03 Australia 8 0.31 Mexico 8 0.06 Poland 8 0.21 Sweden 8 0.76 Hong Kong 7 1.08 Netherlands 7 0.39 Ireland 6 1.17 Switzerland 6 0.68 UAE 6 0.63 Norway 5 0.91 Turkey 5 0.06 Spain 4 0.08 Vietnam 4 0.04 Russia 3 0.02 Belgium 3 0.26 Thailand 3 0.04 Austria 2 0.33 Denmark 2 0.50 Estonia 10 7.54 Lithuania 2 0.70 Philippines 2 0.02 Bangladesh 2 0.01 Bulgaria 1 0.15 Latvia 1[17] 0.53 Finland 1[18] 0.17

Unicorns are concentrated in developed and some developing global regions, including a few dozen countries. As per CB Insights, as of July 13, 2024, the number of unicorn startups in some developed and developing countries were as follows:[19]
